description: Pasture and Profit in Protected Landscapes is a UK-based initiative that promotes pasture-fed livestock, founded 15 years ago by farmers seeking to bridge the knowledge gap in sustainable farming practices. The organization focuses on certifying farms, facilitating knowledge exchange among farmers, and providing consultancy services. With around 1,500 members, it operates on a non-profit model, relying on membership fees and grants to support its activities, while fostering a community committed to regenerative agriculture.
name: Pasture and Profit in Protected Landscapes
